tuv.seg: Tax refund when unemployed or out of work sick
Aisíocaíocht cánach má tá tú dífhostaithe nó as obair ar shaoire bhreoiteachta
You can get a refund of tax you have already paid if you were employed and find yourself unemployed
Is féidir leat aisíoc a fháil ar cháin atá íoctha agat cheana féin má bhí tú fostaithe agus tú dífhostaithe anois
You may also get a tax refund if you are out of work due to illness
Féadtar go mbeadh aisíoc cánach ag dul duit má tá tú as obair mar gheall ar thinneas
You can also get tax back if you are still employed but have paid more tax than you were liable for
Is féidir leat cáin a fháil ar ais má tá tú fós fostaithe agus níos mó cánach íoctha agat ná mar a bhí tú faoi dhliteanas ina leith

Another way to get tax back is through tax relief on services or products that you have bought. Some of the cost of certain services and products can be recouped from the tax you have already paid to Revenue, for example, tax relief for employing a carer and tax relief for third level education fees

Is féidir cáin a fháil ar ais freisin trí fhaoiseamh cánach i leith seirbhísí nó táirgí a cheannaigh tú Is féidir cuid de chostas seirbhísí agus táirgí áirithe a fháil ar ais ón gcáin atá íoctha agat cheana féin leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim, mar shampla, faoiseamh cánach i leith cúramóir a fhostú agus faoiseamh cánach ar tháillí oideachais tríú leibhéal
The amount of relief you get depends on the amount of tax you have paid
Brathannn an méid faoisimh a fhaigheann tú ar mhéid na cánach atá íoctha agat

This document explains how to get a tax refund if you have worked and are now unemployed, getting Illness Benefit or short-term Occupational Injury Benefit, or if you are still employed but think you have paid more tax than you were liable to pay

Míníonn an doiciméad seo conas aisíoc cánach a fháil má bhí tú ag obair agus tú dífhostaithe anois, má tá Sochar Breoiteachta nó Sochar Díobhála Ceirde gearrthéarmach á fháil agat, nó má tá tú dífhostaithe fós ach go gceapann tú gur íoc tú níos mó cánach ná mar a bhí tú faoi dhliteanas ina leith
Why would I get a tax refund?
Cén fáth a mbeadh aisíoc cánach ar fáil dom?
There are a number of reasons why you may now be liable to pay less tax than previously thought and due a refund
Tá cúiseanna éagsúla ann le go mbéifeá faoi dhliteanas anois níos lú cánach a íoc ná mar a cheap tú roimhe seo agus go mbeadh aisíoc dlite duit
Your tax liability may be reduced because you are on unpaid sick leave or have become unemployed
Féadtar go ndéantar do dhliteanas cánach a laghdú mar go bhfuil tú ar saoire bhreoiteachta gan pá nó go bhfuil tú dífhostaithe anois
For PAYE workers your tax liability is spread out evenly over the year
Maidir le hoibrithe ÍMAT roinntear do dhliteanas cánach go cothrom i rith na bliana
To ensure that this is achieved, your tax liability is normally calculated on a cumulative basis
Le cinntiú go mbaintear seo amach, déantar do dhliteanas cánach a ríomh de ghnáth ar bhonn carnach
Any tax credits and standard rate cut-off point, which is not used in a pay period, is carried forward to the next pay period within that tax year
Tugtar aon chreidmheasanna cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh, nach n-úsáidtear i dtréimhse pá, ar aghaidh chuig an chéad thréimhse pá eile sa bhliain chánach sin
This means that when an employer calculates your tax liability, they actually calculate the total tax due from 1 January to the date which your most recent wages are paid
Ciallaíonn sé seo nuair a dhéanann fostaitheoir do dhliteanas cánach a ríomh, déanann sé nó sí an cháin iomlán a ríomh atá dlite ó 1 Eanáir go dtí an dáta ar a n-íoctar do phá is déanaí
This means if your income is reduced, for example, by sickness or unemployment, you will have unused tax credits and may be due a tax refund
Ciallaíonn sé seo má dhéantar d'ioncam a laghdú, mar shampla, trí thinneas nó trí dhífhostaíocht, go bhféadtar go mbeadh aisíoc cánach dlite duit
You may also get a refund if your tax liability has been incorrectly calculated by your employer and you have overpaid tax
Gheobhfá aisíoc cánach freisin mura ndearna d'fhostaitheoir do dhliteanas cánach a ríomh i gceart agus má rinne tú cáin a ró-íocadh
A tax refund may also be paid if you have purchased goods or services for which you can claim tax relief
Féadtar go n-íocfar aisíoc cánach má cheannaigh tú táirgí nó seirbhísí dá bhfuil tú in ann faoiseamh cánach a éileamh
If you are unemployed or out of work sick
Má tá tú dífhostaithe nó ar saoire bhreoiteachta
If tax has been deducted from your pay since 1 January last and you are now unemployed, you may be entitled to a tax refund
Má bhaineadh cáin as do phá ón 1 Eanáir deireanach agus má tá tú dífhostaithe anois féadtar go mbéifeá i dteideal aisíoc cánach a fháil
If you have not paid any tax, you will not be due a refund
Murar íoc tú aon cháin, ní bheidh aisíoc dlite duit

Jobseeker’s Benefit (JB), Illness Benefit (IB) and payments under the Occupational Injury Benefit (OIB) Scheme (including Injury Benefit, Disablement Benefit and Incapacity Supplement) are all taxable sources of income
Is foinsí ioncaim inchánach iad Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist (SCP), Sochar Breoiteachta (SB), agus Sochar Díobhála Ceirde (SDC)
However, the first €13 per week of Jobseeker’s Benefit is not taxable
Níl an chéad €13 in aghaidh na seachtaine de Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist inchánaithe, áfach
Any Increase for a Qualified Child paid with Illness Benefit or a payment under the OIB scheme is not taxable
Níl cion an SB nó an íocaíocht faoin scéim SDC don Mhéadú do Leanbh Incháilithe inchánaithe, áfach

If you are getting Jobseeker’s Benefit, Illness Benefit, or a payment under the Occupational Injury Benefit Scheme and make a claim for a tax refund, the taxable proportion of your JB, IB or OIB payment and your wages are added together to determine if you are entitled to a refund

Má tá Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist, Sochar Breoiteachta, nó Sochar Díobhála Ceirde á fháil agat, agus má dhéanann tú éileamh ar aisíoc cánach, déantar cion inchánach do SCP, SB nó SDC a shuimiú le dearbhú an bhfuil tú i dteideal aisíoc cánach a fháil
If you are employed and think you may have overpaid tax
Má tá tú dífhostaithe agus má cheapann tú go ndearna tú cáin a ró-íoc
If you think your employer has incorrectly calculated your tax liability you must submit your P60 and written details of your claim
Má cheapann tú nach ndearna d'fhostaitheoir do dhliteanas cánach a ríomh i gceart caithfidh tú do P60 agus sonraí i scríbhinn faoi d'éileamh a chur isteach
If your spouse or civil partner is working you must also submit their P60
Má tá do chéile ag obair caithfidh tú a P60 a chur isteach freisin
A P60 is given to you by your employer at the end of each year
Tugann d'fhostaitheoir P60 duit ag deireadh gach bliana
Unemployed or out of work sick
Dífhostaithe nó as obair ar shaoire bhreoiteachta
The amount of tax refund depends on:
Brathfaidh méid an aisíoca cánach ar:
• The length of time you have been unemployed
• Fad do thréimhse dífhostaíochta
• The amount of tax you have paid
• Méid na cánach atá íoctha agat
• The amount of tax credits you have used
• Méid na gcreidmheasanna cánach a d'úsáid tú
• The amount of your weekly social welfare payment
• Méid do íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh sheachtainiúil
How your tax refund is paid
Mar a íoctar d'aisíoc cánach
Revenue will issue a cheque if you are unemployed and due a tax refund
Má tá tú dífhostaithe agus má tá aisíoc cánach dlite duit déanfaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim seic a eisiúint duit
If you are out of work sick, when you return to work your employer usually refunds your tax in your first week's wages
Má tá tú as obair ar shaoire bhreoiteachta, nuair a thagann tú ar ais chun oibre aisíocann d'fhostaitheoir do cháin i do chéad phá seachtaine de ghnáth
You should apply 4 weeks from the date you become unemployed, however, if emergency tax was being deducted by your former employer you should apply immediately
Ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh 4 sheachtain ón dáta ar a dtáinig tú chun bheith dífhostaithe, ach má bhí cáin éigeandála á baint ag d'iarfhostaitheoir ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh gan mhoill
You should apply 8 weeks from the date you became unemployed, if you are getting another income which is taxable. This includes taxable social welfare payments

Ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh 8 seachtain ón dáta ar a dtáinig tú chun bheith dífhostaithe, má tá ioncam eile á fháil agat atá inchánach, agus íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh inchánach san áireamh seo
Your application for a tax repayment because you are unemployed or out of work sick, must be made on tax repayment Form P50 and sent to your tax office with Parts 2 and 3 of your P45

Iarratas ar aisíoc cánach mar go bhfuil tú dífhostaithe nó as obair ar shaoire bhreoiteachta, caithfear é a dhéanamh ar Fhoirm aisíoca cánach P50 agus é a sheoladh chuig d'oifig cánach áitiúil in éineacht le Codanna 2 agus 3 de do P45
When you return to work from unpaid sick leave, you should notify your tax office of the amount of Illness Benefit paid during your illness
Nuair a fhilleann tú ar an obair ó shaoire bhreoiteachta gan íocaíocht, ba chóir duit fógra a thabhairt d’oifig cánach ar mhéid an tSochair Breoiteachta a íocadh le linn do bhreoiteachta
Revenue will then issue you with your correct Tax Credit Certificate
Eiseoidh na Coimisinéirí an Deimhniú Creidmheasa Cánach ceart chugat
Your employer will also get a copy (showing totals only) and refund any tax you are due, when you return to work
Gheobhaidh d’fhostóir cóip freisin (na hiomláin amháin léirithe) agus aisíocfar cáin ar bith a bheidh dlite duit nuair a fhilleann tú ar an obair
For further information on getting a tax refund, contact Revenue
Le tuilleadh eolais maidir le aisíoc a fháil, déan teagmháil leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
Use the Revenue contact locator to find the Lo-call number for your region
Bain úsáid as aimsitheoir teagmhála na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim le huimhir Lóghlao do réigiúin féin a fháil
You can find Revenue contact details for your region here
Is féidir leat sonraí teagmhála na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim do do réigiún féin a fháil anseo
